sentences.sentence: On Saturday, the Chechen leader, Ramzan Kadyrov, published a video which purportedly shows Chechen soldiers in the city.

sentences.sentence: A spokesman for the Ukrainian National Guard denied Lyschansk has been encircled, claiming it remains under the control of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile the Ukrainian Armed Forces shared footage of what it said was an explosion at a Russian army warehouse in eastern Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The exact location and date were not specified.

sentences.sentence: Moscow said more Russian missiles had been fired in the north and south.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The Defense Ministry claims to have used high-precision weapons to destroy five command posts in the Donbas and Mykolaiv regions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It also said three ammunition depots were hit in the vicinity of Zaporizhia, along with the Ukrainian weapons base in Kharkiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: All this a day after an apartment block was hit in Odessa, killing at least 21 people and injuring dozens, an act the Ukrainian president, Volodymyr Zelensky, has called deliberate a claim the Kremlin denies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Here in the Donbas region, Ukrainian soldiers like Vladimir and Artem perhaps didn't envision themselves wearing army gear battling for their country one year ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But since Russia's invasion of Ukraine, things are different, with many citizens feeling compelled to sign up and protect their nation from bombardment.

sentences.sentence: They are riled up and will beat the enemy for sure with complete annihilation until we get to the border of 2014, including Crimea and all it was very difficult for the boys let me emphasize again those were not human conditions they had to fight in it's difficult to explain this to you here what they feel like now or what it was like there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05

sentences.sentence: Leaders from dozens of countries and international organizations will discuss post-war reconstruction of the war-torn country.

sentences.sentence: The rain also damaged many houses in the area.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile in Italy, the country is enduring its worst drought in 70 years, drying out the rice paddies of the river Po Valley.

sentences.sentence: Rome Zoo is distributing frozen fruit, meat and fish to help animals cope with the very high temperatures in the Italian capital.

sentences.sentence: Shade, ponds of cold water and even showers for the elephants.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Everything is being done to help them cope with the heatwave that has come earlier in the year than expected.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Following the persistent hot weather, the mayor of Verona, Damiano Tomasi, signed the ordinance that limits the use of drinking water for domestic purposes for cleaning and hygiene reasons only, until the end of August.

sentences.sentence: The French Civil Aviation Authority has requested preventive flight cancellations and closed part of the runaway as firefighters went on strike.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04

sentences.sentence: Turkish military action in Syria would destabilise the region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Iran's foreign minister gave the warning on a visit to Damascus on Saturday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The comment follows Ankara's announcement that it is planning a new offensive against Kurdish fighters in the north of the country. Amir Abdullah Yen says we will do our best to prevent any military operation from happening and focus on a political solution.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Iran is a major ally of Syrian President Bashar al-Assad and an important trading partner for Turkey.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Tehran says it is trying to establish peace and security between the two nations, but the Syrian government has repeatedly condemned Turkey's threats to mount a new incursion.

sentences.sentence: Fayazil Mekdad says we appreciate the Iranian policy in this field, which calls for improving relations with neighbouring countries, and we believe that it is very necessary to respond to this will because it is a true expression of sovereignty, freedom and independence of decision-making in this region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: including 1,000 Benin bronzes that will be repatriated to Nigeria.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Stolen by British colonial expeditions, vast quantities of treasures in 1897 were taken from the Kingdom of Benin, what is now southwestern Nigeria.

sentences.sentence: We all agree that this is a necessary and important step step also for a new culture and of cooperation with our partner countries in the global south that we just return illegally acquired cultural assets of the colonial context." The artifacts ended up being spread far and wide around the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Hundreds were sold to collections such as the Ethnological Museum in Berlin, which has one of the world's largest groups of historical objects from the Kingdom of Benin, estimated to include about 530 objects.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: A commemorative head of a king and a relief slab depicting a king with four attendants were handed over as German and Nigerian officials signed their joint declaration at the German Foreign Ministry in Berlin.
